plain: The user's favourite genre is likely to be Southern Gothic, as Wise Blood and The Thanatos Syndrome are both examples of the genre. The user's favourite kind of plot is likely to be character-driven, as both Wise Blood and The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time focus heavily on the development of their protagonists. The user's favourite setting is likely to be the American South, as many of the user's favourite books are set there, including Wise Blood, All the Pretty Horses, and To Kill a Mockingbird. The user's favourite writing style is likely to be literary, as many of the user's favourite books are considered classics of American literature. The user's favourite length is likely to be novel-length, as most of the user's favourite books are novels. The user's favourite topic is likely to be the human condition, as many of the user's favourite books deal with complex themes related to the human experience. The user's favourite pacing is likely to be slow and contemplative, as many of the user's favourite books take the time to develop their characters and themes. The user's favourite narrative structure is likely to be third-person omniscient, as many of the user's favourite books are written in this style, allowing for a broad perspective on the story. The user's favourite themes are likely to be morality, spirituality, and the search for meaning in life, as many of the user's favourite books deal with these complex themes.
